main event: Visual and radar sightings of three unidentified objects over San Juan, Puerto Rico on July 8, 1962
interesting points: The objects were observed visually and detected on radar, but the visual observation was described as 'indistinct and insufficient to claim definite identification'.
The radar targets were assessed as being 'manmade', possibly a failure to identify a meteorological balloon or secret aircraft.
The objects were described as having an 'orange colored light', being oval-shaped and slightly larger than a star, and moving at a very slow speed.
The sighting occurred over the San Juan harbor near Pier One at around 1:32 AM.
The altitude of the objects was not determined.
sighted object: three unidentified objects with an orange colored light
photographs: yes, the report indicates photos were taken
